column4: my experience is that KDE will clutter your menu's and then you have to remove all that stuff from your gnome menu
yeah, i don't think i'm going to actually put kde alongside..was just curious
I tried it and never really got into it.  But there are some people who swear by KDE... who knows you may be one of them.  You can always uninstall if you don't like it
yeah, i've used kde before and did like it..somewhat...im pretty sure i'm just going to stick with ubuntu

:-) If you want to have some fun, try a bunch of windows managers.  I recommend Enlightenment and looking glass... they're very different though still not practical (give 'em a year or so development time)
i may have to look into that :)
do you have links to those two programs?
there's a enlightenment repo for Ubuntu... ubuntuguide.org/ubuntu_festy has it
i was wondering cause i would like to see some screenshots and more information about them if its possible
if not then www.get-e.org may have a repo... if you want to compile the latest version then www.enlightenment.org
thanks!
images.google.com search for looking glass, or enlightenment
sounds good
err.... enlightnment gives you religious stuf.... search for "enlightenment desktop"
i used enlightenment ubuntu and got some images - how stable is it, and does it use a large chuck of resources?
Enlightenment uses about as much resource as GNOME, though more than some other ones XFCE
Looking Glass uses a TON of resources... it's REALLY intense, and 3 dimensional, etc. etc.
ah thanks for the info
my pleasure.  I know I had a lot of fun looking at those two, so I'm just passing on the joy
does it play well with Beryl?
no.  neither of those do ... but with Looking Glass you don't need beryl, it's already 3D
ah, i see
